required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Caffeine Supplementation and Personalized Insoles on Females
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Fatigue, Caffeine Supplementation and Personalized Insoles on Biomechanics and Athletic Performance in Female Adult Soccer Players.

brief_summary.textblock: Several studies have shown the positive effect that caffeine has on athletic performance related variables. Nonetheless, most studies have been developed in males and have not studied the possible effects on biomechanics and related injuries. Moreover, the inclusion of personalized insoles could also affect biomechanical patterns and thus injury incidence that has shown to be higher when athletes are fatigued. Therefore, the aim of the present randomized controlled trial is to evaluate the effect of fatigue, caffeine supplementation and personalized insoles on biomechanics and athletic performance in female adult soccer players.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be given a bottle with either caffeine and carbohydrates or just carbohydrates, and personalized insoles or standard insoles. All participants will complete athletic and biomechanics tests before and after completing a 43 minute fatigue protocol.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be given a bottle with either caffeine and carbohydrates or just carbohydrates.

primary_outcome.measure: Agility after fatigue and caffeine supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of agility in seconds before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with photoelectric cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Jump height after fatigue and caffeine supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of jump height in centimetres before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with force plates.

primary_outcome.measure: Repeated sprint ability after fatigue and caffeine supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of repeated sprints ability in seconds before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with photoelectric cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Agility after fatigue and personalized insoles
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of agility in seconds before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with photoelectric cells.

primary_outcome.description: Assessment of jump height in centimetres before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with force plates.

primary_outcome.measure: Repeated sprint ability after fatigue and personalized insoles
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of repeated sprints ability in seconds before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with photoelectric cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Hip range of motion after fatigue and caffeine supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of hip range of motion in degrees assessed with VICON before and after a fatigue protocol is applied. Data will be collected with the VICON motion capture system.

primary_outcome.measure: Knee range of motion after fatigue and caffeine supplementation

secondary_outcome.description: Association between the primary outcomes and injury incidence registered through the International Federation of Association Football questionnaire (F-MARC)
Rate of patients with sleep problems assessed with the Athens sleep questionnaire
Rate of patients with sleep problems assessed with the Athens sleep questionnaire
Rate of patients with sleep problems assessed with the Athens sleep questionnaire

intervention.description: Participants will wear standard insoles and ingest caffeine in liquid form (3mg/kg) with carbohydrates.
Participants will wear personalized insoles and ingest a drink of carbohydrates without caffeine
Participants will wear standard insoles and ingest a drink of carbohydrates without caffeine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females
- Soccer players who have been competing for at least 3 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with major injuries in the lower limbs within the 12 months before testing.
- Participants consuming ephedrine or related medicines
